Identity.GuidelineTitle: Malawi Guidelines for Clinical Management of HIV in Children and Adults 2011

KnowledgeComponents.Recommendation:
Routine ascertainment of HIV infection status for children and adults never tested HIV statusnever tested
Offer HIV testing to patient
tested negative more than 3 months ago HIV test resultnegative
HIV test datemore than 3 months ago
Offer HIV testing to patient
claims to have been tested any time in the past, but without documentation HIV test resultN/A
Offer HIV testing to patient
Routine ascertainment of HIV infection status for children and adults
Ask every client at every visit about the most recent HIV test and review their health passport for previous HIV test results
Routinely document HIV test results on page 6 of the patient’s health passport unless the patient declines
all patients need a confirmatory HIV test to rule out any possibility of mix‐up of test results or fraudulent access to ART
all patients need a confirmatory HIV test to rule out any possibility of mix‐up of test results or fraudulent access to ART

Routine ascertainment of HIV exposure status for children under 24 months For the mother: If she was not tested at least once during pregnancy or delivery child statushas child

HIV test status during pregnancy/deliverynot tested

For the child: If the mother is not available / has died age< 24 months
mother availability statusis not available / has died
For the child: If the child is sick, even if the mother was tested negative during pregnancy or delivery age< 24 months
sicknesspresent
Initiate a new HIV rapid test for the patient

Review mother’s health passport (page 6) for the latest HIV test result

Standard clinical monitoring checklist
Use the summary clinical monitoring checklist to actively screen every HIV patient (exposed child, pre‐ART and ART) for clinical symptoms at every visit
Use the summary clinical monitoring checklist to actively screen every HIV patient (exposed child, pre‐ART and ART) for clinical symptoms at every visit

Provider initiated family planning (PIFP) Implementing routine PIFP in HIV clinic - men age15 years and above
gendermale
Offer a minimum of 30 condoms to patient
Implementing routine PIFP in HIV clinic - women age15 years and above
genderwomen
Offer a minimum of 30 condoms to all women
Offer 1 Depo‐Provera injection every 3 months
Giving Depo‐Provera prescribed drugDepo‐Provera
Inject 1 vial (150mg) in the deltoid muscle

Cotrimoxazole preventive therapy (CPT) All infants born to HIV infected mothers agefrom age 6 weeks
age categoryinfant
confirmed HIV infection statusN/A
mother's HIV statuspositive
Aim to start CPT straight after the infant has finished NVP syrup
Keep the infant on CPT until s/he is confirmed HIV‐negative and is discharged from HCC follow‐up (around age 24 months)
Confirmed HIV infected children from age 6 weeks and adults agefrom age 6 weeks
Confirmed HIV statuspositive
Start patient on CPT

Dosage of Cotrimoxazole Preventive Therapy - less than 6kg CPT eligibilityeligible
weightless than 6kg
dosage is ¼ 480mg tablet 24‐hourly or 1 120mg tablet 12‐hourly or 5ml 24‐hourly
Dosage of Cotrimoxazole Preventive Therapy - 6.0 – 13.9kg CPT eligibilityeligible
weight6.0 – 13.9kg
dosage is 1⁄2 480mg tablet 24‐hourly or 2 120 mg tablets 24‐hourly or 5ml syrup 24‐hourly
Dosage of Cotrimoxazole Preventive Therapy - 14.0 – 29.9kg CPT eligibilityeligible
weight14.0 – 29.9kg
dosage is 1 480mg tablet 24‐hourly
Dosage of Cotrimoxazole Preventive Therapy - 30.0kg and above CPT eligibilityeligible
weight30.0kg and above
dosage is 1 480mg tablet 12‐hourly

ART statuson ART
ART drugcontains EFV

All children who were on the new standard 1st line paediatric regimen (AZT / 3TC / NVP, Regimen 2) ageafter their 15th birthday

ART statuson ART
ART regimen1st line paediatric
weightis over 25kg

ART statuson ART
ART regimen2nd line regimen - Regimen 9P
change patient to standard adult 2nd line regimen (Regimen 7A)
